pages.text: Way way back in the days of Minecraft 1.16, Jeb_ himself released a series of 8 'Combat Test Snapshots' intended to rework and address crippling design problems with post 1.8 PvP and PvE. These were widely beloved by many then immediately shelved and remain unaddressed in development limbo to this day. Combat Nouveau implements changes from these snapshots in Modern Versions.

pages.title: Food Nerfs
pages.text: Healing will no longer use your saturation at all. Instead, hunger is consumed directly from your hunger bar as it used to when saturation is empty, and instead of stopping at 18 (8 1/2 meat shanks) it now stops at 6 (3 meat shanks). If you're attempting to eat and take damage, it will interrupt the eating animation.

pages.title: Potion Buffs
pages.text: All non-throwable potions now stack all the way up to 16. Instant Health and Instant Damage are more potent. Strength is now a percentage increase instead of a flat increase.

pages.title: Swing Timing
pages.text: You are no longer able to spam click your swings, you must instead wait the entire charge time to be able to swing your weapon again. In exchange, you can actually hold down the button to swing, but it's a few ticks slower than optimally timing your clicks.

pages.title: Shield Mechs & Parrying
pages.text: Rather than blocking all damage when right clicked and differing only in durability, shields now block a percentage of damage when equipped and an additional large percentage of damage when used. Precise timing also allows you to parry projectiles!

pages.title: Your Last Chance
pages.text: In the interest of some amount fairness to people playing with mods they know nothing of, you actually have one-shot protection. If a hit that would ordinarily kill you happens when you have over 8 hearts, you'll instead be left on one heart and a sound will play to let you know you've been given another shot.
